Params: {2: '...What is the Purifying Force doing here?', 3: '7'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'I just spoke with Asimov on the comms to confirm the missions assigned to the members of the Purifying Force.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Bianca... is in City 15 right now conducting her mission.', 4: '1'}
{2: "It wouldn't be suitable for this mission.", 3: '16'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'The kind of fighting method that ignores damage to the M.I.N.D. is nothing like... what Bianca would do.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Based on the information revealed in our conversation, continued use of simulated camouflage is no longer necessary.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Bianca's body dissolves into the air, turning into a tiny data stream of flashing neon light."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: 'There is no reason to stay here. Huaxu does not permit purposeless actions.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The "Bianca" who claims to take orders from Huaxu vanishes into thin air in front of the Gray Ravens.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "There are no traces left behind in the virtual space. It didn't leave by moving.", 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Then how did the program escape? Advanced camouflage? A cross-program pathway as a springboard? Directly hijacking remote data? Altering the lower port levels of Gestalt?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "It couldn't have been changing the port levels. The risk of being detected by Gestalt's anti-interference protocols is too high...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'First and foremost, cross-reference with a data slice from five minutes ago.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Commandant, what method do you think she used?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'We have to rely on your reasoning to figure this out. Having been dissociated with living as a human for so long, our way of thinking is closer to that of a machine.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "It's harder to figure out our blind spots when we all think alike.", 4: '2'}
{3: "(No... Liv's scanning capability would've detected any signs of camouflage...)"}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "It's unlikely to maintain an advanced data camouflage in front of Liv. If there were any sign of hijacking a program, there would've been traces left behind...", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Lee', 3: "Forcibly hijacking a program requires a burst of considerable data strength, but I didn't detect any change in level output... And data camouflage doesn't seem too possible with Liv around...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'In that case, maybe we should consider the possibility that the program utilized data replacement as a springboard?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'There is no way to detect it directly, but utilizing data replacement at such a high speed is bound to make the target program behave abnormally.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'If you find the abnormal program... You would be able to track the movement of "Bianca"... Is that so?', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Liv will be in charge of scanning, and I'll be in charge of data analysis.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Huaxu', 3: 'The sub-terminal was detected by the Babylonia task force.'}
{2: 'Huaxu', 3: 'However, it has not been located by them. It is proceeding to its new position according to the previous bridge route.'}
{2: 'Huaxu', 3: 'Data masking has been initiated. The goal of delaying the task force in their search is partially complete.'}
{2: 'Huaxu', 3: 'Computing power has been prioritized to maintain infiltration efforts. It was impossible to allocate enough power to the sub-terminal for combat purposes.'}
